column4: hello. I installed Hardy recently. But looks like ubuntu is keeping my CPU a little too busy. Can someone suggest me a lightweight linuxdistro?
xubuntu or fluxubuntu could be better alternatives in that case
not at all, xubuntu and fluxbuntu are full leightweight distro's
i run xubuntu right now as we type, have been since 7.10, works great
ok. i will try. alternatively i am wondering whether i should uninstall some packages from hardy. Will that help me?
it wouldn't do much no, besides lightening your hard disk .. gnome (and the gnome based applications) are what makes regular ubuntu a bit heavy on older hardware
so you mean xubuntu is good? i am really confused which one to go for
i do believe you can uninstall ubuntu-desktop and replace that with xubuntu-desktop, no need to reinstall since the underlying linux base is exacxtly the same
since i am familar with ubuntu i think i should go for xubuntu
sure xubuntu is good, it's officially supported by canonical just like kubuntu and ubuntu
i think xubuntu-desktop does that yes, hang on i'll check
all you need to do is install the "xubuntu-desktop" package, then choose the "xfce-session" or similar selection from the GDM login manager and you're all set
do that via Synaptic and you'll get to see what gets installed that way before committing, just to be on the safe side
